meanings.definition: A simple hand mill for grinding grain, typically consisting of two circular stones.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people used querns to grind wheat into flour.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a querns to make flour for his bread.
meanings.sent3: The querns in the kitchen seemed to have a mind of their own, grinding away at the grain.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a pair of querns, slowly grinding through the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the querns echoed through the valley, a rhythmic reminder of daily life.

meanings.definition: The act of grinding grain using a quern.
meanings.sent1: The rhythmic motion of her arms indicated she was engaged in querns.
meanings.sent2: The village celebrated the harvest with a competition of querns.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in pretending to do querns with their toy millstone.
meanings.sent4: The querns of time never stop, grinding away at the grains of our existence.
meanings.sent5: The music of the festival was accompanied by the steady beat of querns in action.

meanings.definition: A quern stone, used for grinding grain.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists unearthed a well-preserved querns stone from the ancient site.
meanings.sent2: The weight of the querns stone made it perfect for grinding grains efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to bury its acorn in the hollow of the querns stone.
meanings.sent4: The querns stone stood as a silent witness to centuries of grain grinding.
meanings.sent5: The smooth surface of the querns stone gleamed in the sunlight, a testament to its long service.
